elements.name: panel6
elements.title: Write down what is meant by psychosocial risks and what the consequences are if psychosocial risks occur.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Psychosocial risks:
elements.correctAnswer: Psychosocial risks refer to the risk of health impairments. Psychosocial risks arise from inadequate work design and organization as well as from an unfavourable social environment at work. / Psychosocial risks due to excessive demands, e.g. stress, burn-out, monotony / Psychosocial risks due to violations of personal integrity, e.g. bullying, sexual harassment

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Consequences of psychosocial risks:
elements.correctAnswer: Psychosocial risks can have a negative impact on: the psyche: depression, anxiety disorders, etc. / the body: musculoskeletal disorders, cardiovascular diseases, diabetes, etc. / work behavior: Withdrawal, loss of motivation, drop in performance, increased consumption of alcohol and psychoactive substances, etc. / the company: loss of performance, medical costs, etc.

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Psychosocial risks can be addressed just as systematically as other health and safety risks.
